analyzeResult.content:
-
PHILIP MORRIS USA
INTER-OFFICE CORRESPONDENCE 120 PARK AVENUE, NEW YORK, NY 10017-5592
TO: DISTRIBUTION
DATE: July 15, 1991
FROM: Marketing Information & Analysis/ Joseph J. Auriemma Japh 8. Cusinara
SUBJECT: SMITTY'S VOLUME INCENTIVE PROGRAM EVALUATION
The following preliminary report utilizes PM's Rapid Fact database to analyze the volume/share impact of the first six weeks of the Smitty's Volume Incentive Program. This program began on May 1st, executing a thirteen week cycle of rotating Philip Morris Full Margin promotions with endcap, temporary display and feature advertisement. Full Margin volume gains achieved during the promotion cycle can qualify Smitty's for a retailer incentive bonus, which increases with performance.
Note: At the account's request, all promotions are executed from mid-week (Wednesday through Tuesday). Since the account's scanning data is only available for week-end periods (Monday through Sunday), an individual promotion's first/cumulative response may be understated. Therefore, while the overall program performance can be measured cumulatively, the response of each individual promotion will be evaluated based on the second week of the execution.
SUMMARY
. Total Philip Morris Full Margin volume increased +4.7% during the first six weeks of the Smitty's Volume Incentive Program, relative to the pre-promotional trend. This increase, if applied to the graduated payment schedule offered to Smitty's, would not qualify the account for an incentive bonus payment (A minimum of 10% is required for a bonus payment).
. Total Industry volume, which was declining significantly versus year-ago levels (-16% as reported by InfoScan) prior to the start of the Volume Incentive Program, increased 1.3% during the first six weeks of the program. Both Full Margin and Price Value contributing evenly to this volume increase.
Full Margin experienced a +0.8% volume gain, tied to the increased PM Full Margin business. Price Value volume increased +2.4%, primarily due to Sub-Generic growth and higher coupon values on Doral ($3.50) and Cambridge ($4.00).
. The Marlboro Racing Sweepstakes/$2.00 Price Reduction promotion was successful in generating incremental brand volume (+32.1%) and share (+7.7 points). Marlboro did not experience volume/share pay-back in the two weeks following the brand's promotion, despite the execution of the Merit "Travel Kit" promotion immediately following the Marlboro event.
Marlboro's response to the Racing Sweepstakes/$2.00 Price Reduction promotion executed in Smitty's was similar to the brand's response to the same promotion in a test conducted in Schnucks supermarkets in St. Louis (volume: +48.2%, share: +6.4 points).
Â· Merit's volume (+8.7%) and share (+0.4 points) increased above the brand's pre-program trends during execution of the Merit "Travel Kit" promotion, the second promotion in the program's thirteen week cycle. For two weeks following this promotion, Merit's volume/share remained above pre-program trends, indicating that the brand did not experience pay-back during these weeks.
Importantly, Merit experienced significantly higher promotional response during recent participation in Smitty's "Shopper's Passport" Program, a frequent shopper program offering "member" customers scanned savings on selected products. In December 1990, Merit experienced a +16.1% volume or +0.7 share point increase with a $2.00-off carton promotion in this program. In February 1991, Merit experiencing a volume gain of +62.5% translating into +2.5 share points with a simultaneous $0.50-off pack/$2.00-off carton promotion.
2073004702

SUBJECT: SMITTY'S VOLUME INCENTIVE PROGRAM EVALUATION

This program began on May 1st, executing a thirteen week cycle of rotating Philip Morris Full Margin promotions with endcap, temporary display and feature advertisement. Therefore, while the overall program performance can be measured cumulatively, the response of each individual promotion will be evaluated based on the second week of the execution.

. Total Philip Morris Full Margin volume increased +4.7% during the first six weeks of the Smitty's Volume Incentive Program, relative to the pre-promotional trend. Full Margin experienced a +0.8% volume gain, tied to the increased PM Full Margin business. Price Value volume increased +2.4%, primarily due to Sub-Generic growth and higher coupon values on Doral ($3.50) and Cambridge ($4.00).

. The Marlboro Racing Sweepstakes/$2.00 Price Reduction promotion was successful in generating incremental brand volume (+32.1%) and share (+7.7 points). Marlboro did not experience volume/share pay-back in the two weeks following the brand's promotion, despite the execution of the Merit "Travel Kit" promotion immediately following the Marlboro event.

Â· Merit's volume (+8.7%) and share (+0.4 points) increased above the brand's pre-program trends during execution of the Merit "Travel Kit" promotion, the second promotion in the program's thirteen week cycle. For two weeks following this promotion, Merit's volume/share remained above pre-program trends, indicating that the brand did not experience pay-back during these weeks.

Importantly, Merit experienced significantly higher promotional response during recent participation in Smitty's "Shopper's Passport" Program, a frequent shopper program offering "member" customers scanned savings on selected products.
